Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, were you really serious about wanting this golden Corona Navalis charm?
Well, I'd definitely prefer it. Why?
I'm just ready to trade it in for some new piece of art.
Already?
What do you mean "already?" I've kept it for longer than usual, waiting for you to trade something for it.

Fields.MenuText: You were serious about that? I thought you were joking.
Well, I've been keeping an eye out, but you're a hard woman to shop for.
I didn't realize you went through art so quickly.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always serious when it comes to art!
You have a point. I do have very fine tastes. Not just anything will satisfy my need for art.
Well, I do. I don't see the point of keeping art for so long. If I've seen it once, I can remember it forever.
I guess I can hold onto it a little longer for you. Just be quick about it. I really need some new art in my life.
I'll find you something as soon as I can. I promise.
Good. I'm holding you to that.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Cesare, do you have a moment? I've got some questions for you.
Are you looking for hints on what to get me? It won't be that easy. You'll have to figure out what I'd like on your own.
That's not what this is about, but I'll keep that in mind.
Oh, then what's up, Capitano?
Well, after our successful mission in the U.S. we're being given our choice of assignment. I remember you saying you wanted to travel more. Now's your chance.
What do you mean?
I mean, we can pick our next assignment based on location. If you'd like.
Oh, I see! We can go somewhere I've always wanted to go, and just ignore the mission!

Fields.MenuText: Well, no. We'd still have to do the mission.
Exactly. Let's be lazy.
You'd want to ignore the mission? That doesn't exactly sound like you.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I was about to be very upset with you, Capitano.
What are you thinking, Capitano? We can't just ignore the Morganas!
It's not like me. Ignoring our mission would be really inappropriate.
Wherever we go, we need to make sure we actually do the mission.
Okay, agreed. But where are we going?
*ALARM*
Well, right now, it sounds like we're going to battle.
Why is it so hard to get an answer out of her sometimes?
@BATTLE
Hmmmm...
Cesare? Have you come up with an answer?
I'm thinking.
You've been thinking for a while now. If we don't pick an assignment soon, they'll just pick one for us.
Hmph, fine. Then let's go to... somewhere in Asia!
Asia's a big place.
Yeah, and I've never been. I've heard great things, though! Maybe Korea? Or Japan even?! I've always wanted to see Japan.

Fields.MenuText: It's a lovely place.
From what I've heard, Japan is a pretty great vacation destination.
Eh, I'm not looking forward to this. I hate sushi.

Fields.DialogueText: You've been? You're so lucky! You'll have to show me all the sights! I mean... from the ship, of course.
Right? Do you think we'll meet a samurai?
You hate sushi? Would you like it better if I cooked it for you? But then I guess it really wouldn't be sushi, now would it?
Alright, I'll see if I can get us an assignment in Japan.
Or Korea if there's nothing in Japan!
I'll remember.
You better! I'm really looking forward to this trip now.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Good news, Cesare. I've got our new mission.
Already? If it's good news, then it better be in Japan. Or Korea.
It's in Japan.
Really? I thought for sure you wouldn't be able to get anything good.
Do you really have so little faith in me?
No. I mean yes? I'm not really all that sure. The only thing I definitely have faith in is God Almighty.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that hurts.
Eh, there's no competing with that.
I guess God might've helped get us this mission.

Fields.DialogueText: Why? Were you really comparing yourself to God? Haven't you heard the story about Icarus?
Exactly. But you're pretty good too.
He does work in mysterious ways.
You know what this means, don't you?
No? Should I?
Before we go to Japan, you need to get me something to trade. Unless you want me to trade this necklace. I'm not going east without art to trade!
All right, all right, I hear you.
Of course you do. I'm standing right here. You shouldn't be, though. You should be shopping.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What... is this? A mask?
It's your new art. Something for you to trade with in Japan.
This... isn't art.

Fields.MenuText: You think almost everything is art.
That's not what the guy that sold it to me said.
It's the best I could do. I hate shopping.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not. I think art is art. And this isn't.
Why would anyone call this art? He was probably lying, right? Trying to unload it on a sucker... Oh, that makes you the sucker.
Do you hate me too? Giving me something like this... Makes me feel like you must hate me.
I take it that means you don't like it?
No. This hurts my eyes. I'm not even sure what it's supposed to be.
He said it was some sort of ancient mask.
Hmmm. Maybe it was worn in battle to make the enemy want to avert their eyes.
I get it. It's ugly.
Maybe we should try it on the Morganas. They might run away at the sight of it.
You don't have to keep making fun of me.
Make fun of you? I'm serious. This could actually have some interesting battle applications. This hideous thing could be useful after all.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I'm sensing a group of Morganas approaching us.
More Morganas? Are you sure?
Do you really think I'd be coming to the capitano if I wasn't?
Of course you wouldn't, Cesare. Get in position and sound the alarm. We've got another fight on our hands.
Yes, Captain. You can count on us!
What about me?
Do what you always do. Win.
@BATTLE
That was impressive, Capitano. You have a real talent for leading the crew.
It's not really a talent. It took a lot of practice to develop the skill.
That's not a talent? Isn't a talent just something you're good at?
Not... quite? Do you really not understand what a talent is?
Well... I'm pretty sure I've never had one.
What?
Well... my sister always used to tell me that my talent was "TBD". Never really knew what that meant.

Fields.MenuText: That's harsh. Especially from your sister.
Yeah... uh, no idea what that means either. You'll have to ask her someday.
I'm sure she was joking.

Fields.DialogueText: Harsh? Why is it harsh? What's "TBD"?
I'd ask her before and she'd just laugh at me. It was always so annoying how she'd take joy in avoiding my questions.
My sister's not much of a joker. At least... If she is, I never understood any of her jokes.
I don't think I'll ever have a talent. Are there just untalented people out there?
I guess, but I don't think you're one of those people. I'm sure you have a talent.
You really think so?
Yeah. And I'll help you find it. Promise.
I think it means "To Be Determined."
Oh! So my talent is being determined! I guess I am pretty determined, if I think about it...
So if it's not something that you're good at, then what is a talent?
Well, you're close. It's something you're good at without really trying.
Without trying? So... like breathing? I never even try to breathe, but I'm always doing it. Is that a talent?

Fields.MenuText: Uh, yup. Sure.
Not quite. That's just a natural biological function.
You breathe? I wasn't actually sure if Belles had to.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?! I have a talent!? Wait... this seems too easy. Doesn't that mean that every living thing has the same talent?
So a talent has to be something unnatural? Got it. Go on.
Well... I don't know if I have to, but I do. Without even thinking. Maybe I should see if I can go without breathing some time...
Okay, you're not quite getting it. Maybe an example would help.
A while ago I knew this guy who could drink anyone under the table. It was like alcohol didn't affect him. That's a talent.
Being able to drink a lot?
Yeah. It wasn't something he practiced, it was just this natural affinity he had. An inability to get drunk. He ended up making a hobby of outdrinking every new recruit their first night.
People with talents have hobbies? Okay... and drinking is a talent?
Are you taking notes?
How else am I supposed to learn my talent?
You're still not getting it...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, Cesare, today we're going to figure out what your talent is.
Today? Right now? That's a whole lot of pressure. What if we don't figure it out? Are you going to be disappointed in me?
Don't overthink it, okay? Let's just start with something easy. What kinds of things have you done?
What do you mean? Are we talking about breathing again?
No, I just mean in your life. What have you tried doing? You find out what you're good at by doing things.
Oh... well, I mean I've done a lot of things. I've been a flagship! I was actually a really good flagship. Is that a talent?
Maybe... Just keep going. What else have you done?
Well, I was a teacher for a short time. I was made an officer in the Carabinieri. Oh, and I did a little modeling for photographs.

Fields.MenuText: A teacher? What did you teach?
You were in the Carabinieri? I'm having trouble picturing you in the military police force.
You modeled? I hope they were tasteful photographs.

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly? No idea. I'm still not even sure why they made me do it. I just stood in front of a chalkboard and talked. I gave everyone an A though, so I guess they learned.
Well, on an honorary basis. I doubt I would have made it for real. They said I asked too many questions.
Of course they were tasteful, Capitano. I'm told I looked so lovely leaving port that people just had to take photographs. And that was before I was a Belle. Imagine all the photos they'd take now.
Okay, so we know what you've already tried. That's a good start.
Great, I'm glad I could help... How did I help?
Well, would you say you had a natural talent for any of these things?
Not... really?
Well, then we know what you're not talented at. Which is better than not knowing anything.
I guess, but I'd really rather know what I am talented at.
Baby steps, Cesare.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I need your honest opinion on something.
I wouldn't give you anything else. What's going on?
Well, you said my talent was probably something I haven't tried yet. So look at this! I think I might be a painter!
Uh, I think you might've spilled some paint on your art.
Huh? Oh, no, this is what it's supposed to look like.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, in that case it's lovely.
Were you trying to paint a green puddle?
It's horrible. I won't lie.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I mean, I was pretty sure I... wait, why does your face look like that? You look like you swallowed a handful of nails.
No, this is what I imagine Japan's going to be like!
I was afraid you'd say that...
I'm not a painter, am I?
I'm afraid not.
Well, back to the drawing board.
I'd probably skip the drawing board if I were you. I'm afraid it'd come out like your painting.
Are you making a joke? It's not very funny.
Cheer up. We're almost to Japan. You've got to be looking forward to that, right?
Yeah, I really am. I can't wait to trade away that hideous mask you got me.
It's not that bad.
I might not know what my talent is, but I know yours isn't shopping.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Okay, I know it's going to be hard, but do your best to trade me something good with this.
This mask?! It's... horrifying. I'll do my best, but no promises.

Fields.MenuText: It's a beautiful piece of art.
Yeah, I know it's ugly. How many times do I have to apologize?
At least it was expensive. Doesn't that count for anything?

Fields.DialogueText: Are you having problems with your vision, Capitano? You may need a checkup if you really think this is beautiful.
At least once more. This image will be haunting my nightmares for some time now.
Not really. Mostly it just means you were a sucker.
You don't have to be so harsh with him. He tried his best. His best was just horrible.
Of course, Cesare. Wish me luck.
Good luck!
I'm not sure I like him.
You're just jealous of his talent at shopping.
Maybe a little. Is that really the first thing you want to do now that we're in Japan? Send your shopper to get you a new piece of art?
Well, I want to go and explore the city, but that's not really an option for me. The art I get in every city is really the only way I can experience anything more than the port.
It makes a lot more sense when you put it that way.
Thanks, Capitano. Now, if you still want this gold necklace, you're going to have to go out there and get me something better than some ugly mask.
Wait, but he's going out to get you something, just like you wanted.
Yeah, and I want you to get me something better.
I feel like she's just doing this to torture me at this point.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, look what I got in exchange for that horrifying mask of yours! Isn't it beautiful?!
A kimono? It looks very nice. It'd probably look better on you, though.
On me? What do you mean?
You're supposed to wear it. It's kind of like a robe.
Oh, that makes so much more sense! I thought it was just a wall hanging, or maybe a towel.
If you're looking to trade it again, I definitely wouldn't use it as a towel.
Obviously. But... do you actually think I would look good in something like this?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure you'd be able to pull it off.
I'm sure it'd look fantastic on you.
Honestly, I think you look better in what you're wearing right now.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean? All I'd have to do is untie this part, right? Then I think it should just slip off, right? It's not that complicated.
Yeah? Maybe I should try it on then... Just for a little bit.
Really? I wear this all the time, though. I'm not doing anything special.
All right. I'm going to go try it on, just to see it. I have to, right?
You sound really excited.
You saw it, right?! It's so beautiful. And I can wear it. I gotta go right now and see what I look like in it.
How did he get her something so perfect? I need to learn his secrets.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You. You need to tell me everything right now.
Excuse me?
How are you so good at shopping for Cesare?
It's really not all that hard. You just need to, well, know what you're doing.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, I've never been too good at shopping.
Hey, I'm an excellent shopper. Just not for other people.
What? I'm so confused. Is this how Cesare feels all the time?

Fields.DialogueText: Clearly. I wouldn't be surprised to learn that you've never even bought your own clothes.
Shopping really only ever has meaning when you're doing it for another person.
Maybe I should talk slower, to make sure you're following everything.
Listen, shopping for Cesare is easy when you know what she likes. Jewelry, crowns, sparkly things, unique things, marble, things with historical significance-
Wait, the mask I got her was unique.
It was disgusting. Forget about that mask. If you want to get Cesare something she'll love, look for something beautiful that has a story.
A story, huh? What was the story of that viking statue you got her a while back?
Oh, that? I just thought she'd get a kick out of that. And I was right. So listen to me and take my advice. Look for the story.
Story. Got it.
Oh, and make sure it's not hideous. No story can save something as ugly as that mask you got her.
Hey, you said forget about the mask!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I never even asked, did I?
Asked what?
What our mission was. I was just so excited to be traveling all this way, I didn't even stop to ask why. That's new for me.
You're right. There's usually never a question you don't ask.
Exactly. So I'm asking now. Why are we here?
Well, we're just here to patrol. Apparently something's going on nearby that's taking a lot of our attention away from the area. We're here to fill the holes.
Hmmmm... doesn't that seem like a waste of our skills? Shouldn't we be helping with whatever's going on nearby?

Fields.MenuText: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.
Well, if we did that, we wouldn't be in Japan like you wanted.
Even the smaller, less glamorous jobs are important, Cesare.

Fields.DialogueText: We have a horse? No, wait, that's a saying, right? I've heard that before. But what is a gift horse? I've never seen a horse with a bow on it. I don't think they'd like that, would they?
That's a good point. I am enjoying the sightseeing.
Of course they are. Someone does need to protect the ports. And we have been fighting a lot of Morganas here. Yeah, I think we're needed here, right?
*ALARM*
Well, what do you know? It's our reason for being here.
Morganas. I guess it really is a good thing we're here.
We can't let these monsters do whatever they like.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I've made an unfortunate discovery.
And what would that be?
I don't possess a talent for sewing, dancing, or wearing a kimono...

Fields.MenuText: I think I can connect the dots.
What exactly happened, Cesare?
You know what? I don't think I even want to know the details.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have any questions? That seems weird to me.
It's a little embarrassing. Can we just say my kimono... broke?
Good, because the details are my least favorite part.
Okay, now I think you really need to explain everything.
Do I really have to?
Yes. No excuses.
Okay... I was trying on my new kimono before I traded it for something new, and I looked so pretty that I just start spinning around and... I guess it snagged on something and ripped.
And then you tried to sew it back together?
My fingers hurt.
Yeah, sewing is pretty hard.
I think I just don't have a talent. My sister was right.
Hey, she said your talent was TBD, right? That stands for "To Be Determined."
Oh, that's what that stands for? I forgot. Right now I feel like it stands for "Totally Brain Dead."
Goodness, no! I don't think your sister would say something like that. She... she didn't mean that you had no talent, only that you haven't discovered it yet.
You really think so? I just need to find some hidden skill?
I'm sure of it, Cesare. And we'll find it. It just might take a little while. It's going to be a process of elimination.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, I finally found a little time off ship. Let's find Cesare something she won't hate this time.
All right, let's see here. Oh, that shield looks cool... Wait, that's the same thing I thought about that mask.
Maybe I need to look around a little more.
Hello there, can I help you pick out something today?
Uh, yeah, actually. I'm... I guess I'm looking for something with a story.
I see. You're looking for something more than a trinket or bauble. A souvenir with some history. I like it. I think I have just the thing.
Look at this beautiful painting I have here.
Looks like a tree.
A tree overlooking a beautiful view of the sea. The artist would paint this tree every day of his life, but he destroyed his every attempt. He was never satisfied.
Until he got it perfect with this one?
Well, actually until he died. He took his last breath after his final stroke.

Fields.MenuText: That's a pretty nice story. I think she might love it.
Is even a word of that true?
So it's just trash that didn't get a chance to be destroyed. Seems like it shouldn't be too pricey.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, if you're buying this as a gift, I'm sure they'll adore the entire package.
Would you care if it wasn't? You're just looking for a good story, right?
Ah, a shrewd customer. I like it. I'm sure we can come to an agreement.
You know what, I'll take it. Can you wrap it up for me?
Of course. Give me but a moment. You won't regret this purchase.
Hope not. I don't need a repeat of that ugly mask.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hey... Capitano... you... called me?
Cesare? Why are you out of breath?
I was seeing if I was... I'm not a runner. I don't... think I'm really athletic... at all.
Well, at least now you know.
I'm also not good at singing, I can't cook, and apparently I ask too many questions to be a good listener.

Fields.MenuText: You tried singing? And you didn't invite me to listen?
I would've thought you'd have learned a thing or two from our cooks.
Well, I could've told you that last one.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't let anyone listen, but people were banging on my door telling me to stop. Maybe I shouldn't have done it in the middle of the night.
Well, I tried to, but the best I could do was mediocre. I think our cooks just might be magical.
Well, why would anyone tell you their problems if they didn't want you to ask questions and try to fix it? It doesn't make sense to me.
I still have more ideas, though, so I'm not giving up just yet.
Well, that's the important part.
Did you really need me for something?
Actually, I just wanted to give you-
*ALARM*
Dang it, I'm still exhausted from all the running.
Well, you better catch your breath quick.
@BATTLE
Cesare, we have to change our course.
What's going on?
Remember that situation nearby? The reason they needed us to patrol the area?
Is it getting worse? Do they need us to come in and save the day?
Well, actually, yeah. I don't know the details, but they're calling for aid, and we're the closest.
Nothing could make this trip better. Let's ride in and defeat whatever horrible monster is causing trouble this time!

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you're so eager to leave. I thought you were enjoying Japan.
Sounds good to me. Let's hurry.
You're sure you don't want to do a little more sightseeing?

Fields.DialogueText: I am, but I don't need to stay forever. I can just remember it. Kind of like art.
Glad we're on the same page. We have no time to waste.
Do you really think we have time for that? Or is this about something else? Have you still not gone and gotten me something to trade for my necklace? You need to hurry up, Capitano.
Say goodbye to Japan for now, Capitano. We can always come back after we save the day.
As long as we survive.
Of course we'll survive. We always survive. Why wouldn't we survive?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Do you know what we're fighting, Capitano?
Probably Morganas.
Well, obviously. But what about the details? How many? How big? How dangerous?

Fields.MenuText: Your guess is as good as mine.
They're the worst of the worst. Whatever you're imagining, multiply it by a million.
I couldn't care less about the details.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm... then I'm going to guess a lot. And they're probably really big, right? And dangerous. Wait, should I be guessing that they're weak? Would that affect the outcome?
A million? I'm not even sure I can do that math... Give me a minute.
But Cavour always said that knowledge was power. So wouldn't that mean that the more details we know, the more power we have? My sister's usually right about this stuff.
We're pretty much going into this fight knowing nothing. For some reason we're not getting any more communications from the ships out there.
That's not a good sign. Maybe they're all dead? Or maybe they were teleported to an alternate dimension.
Your imagination is getting away from you again. They're probably just busy fighting the Morganas.
I hope so. Because the alternative explanation could be vampires.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Vampires?!
They should be... right there.
You mean in that giant storm?
Exactly. I think we know why they weren't able to communicate.
So... not vampires?
No. The storm is probably messing with their equipment.
If they're still alive in there.

Fields.MenuText: Don't even joke about that.
That is something we should be wary of. We could be walking into an ambush.
You're not talking about vampires again, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not joking. If the Morganas defeated them, this could be a trap.
Let's hope they're still alive in there. Or that they at least hurt the Morganas enough for us to finish them off.
I wasn't, but now that you mentioned it we might want to grab some garlic. I mean, just in case.
Well, we're not doing anyone any good out here. Let's head in.
You're sure this is a good idea, right?
No, but I really do think that we can handle whatever is waiting for us in there.
Okay, then I do too. Let's go!
@BATTLE
That's the Morgana we're dealing with?! It's huge!
And it's not the only one. Now that we're in here, I can sense more of these things.
All the same size?
More or less.
*BOOM*
What was that? Are they attacking us? Are we hit?
No, we're fine. The Morgana was the one who took the hit.

Fields.MenuText: Are they turning on each other?
So our allies are still alive in this storm?
Was it spontaneous combustion?

Fields.DialogueText: Is that a possibility? Could we have secret allies among the Morganas?
Either that or they're undead. But either way, they still seem to be on our side.
Is that really a thing? Should I start carrying a bucket of water with me?
*BOOM*
It's taking more hits.
And I think they've noticed us, too. We might want to start firing while we can!
Good call. Let's take these guys out.
@BATTLE
So, they weren't vampires.
I didn't think so. Vampires aren't real. Right?
No, as far as I know. They were thankful that we came to help them finish the last of those Morganas off.
Isn't it weird that the storm stopped just as we defeated the last Morgana? Could they have been causing it? There's so much we don't know about these things.
And you're getting caught in your own thoughts again.
Actually, you know... this might be a good time for me to give you something.
Something? You got me something? Did you actually go and get me a new piece of art?
Actually I did. Here.
Ooh, it's wrapped and everything. ... Oh, it's a painting! It's lovely.
They say the artist would paint that same tree every day, destroying every attempt until he got it perfect. Only then did he let himself pass on.
Really? Painting this was able to keep him alive?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe. That's what the guy told me.
That's the legend. The only people who know for certain are long gone.
Probably not. I think it was just something the guy that sold it to me made up.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, so it's a story that's been passed from person to person throughout the ages? So interesting!
Amazing! So this is a legendary piece of art? I love it!
Really? Oh, well, that's less interesting. Or... wait, are you just saying that? Is there something more to this painting? Do you want me to overlook it? This will take some digging.
So does that mean I did a good job?
You did a great job. This is so much better than that hideous mask.
I knew I could shop.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What are you doing out here, Cesare?
Just jotting some things down. Taking a break from trying to find my talent.
What are you jotting down?
I don't know. Just words. I like to make them rhyme.
Cesare, I think that's poetry.
Hey, don't just read over my shoulder like that.
Pretty good poetry, actually. How long have you been doing this?
Always? It's just something I do when I feel like it.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a hobby.
So why have you been running around everywhere looking for a talent?
And you've always been this good? Sounds like a talent to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, if it's a hobby, it's not a talent. Right? Is that how it works?
What does that have to do with anything?
A talent? You're messing with me right?
Cesare, being able to write stuff like this without even trying is a talent.
What are you talking about? Everyone can write. Wait, are you illiterate, Capitano?
There's a difference between writing words and writing feelings. From the little I managed to read, you might have a serious knack for writing poetry.
I'm writing poetry? I always thought poetry was harder.
For some people it is, but for others it just comes naturally.
So I have a talent? I have a talent! I'm talented! I can't wait to tell Cavour!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I can't believe I almost forgot. You definitely earned this necklace.
About time. I felt like I earned it with the mask.
Ha! Definitely not! But the painting was more than good enough. Here.

Fields.MenuText: I feel like trying to get it was more fun than actually getting it.
It feels good to finally earn the gold.
It looked bigger around your neck.

Fields.DialogueText: I can take it back if that's how you really feel.
You definitely deserve it. The painting you got me might be my favorite piece of art yet.
Really? I wouldn't know. I can't see something around my own neck. I mean, I can lift it up, but that's not really the same, right?
Ouch. I think the chain might be a little tight on me.
Yeah, it does look like it might be choking you a little. Why is that? Your neck isn't that much bigger than mine, is it?
I don't know. Maybe it just likes you better.
What? You're giving it back?
If I can't wear it, it's no good to me.
But... that means now I have to get you something else. To trade for the painting you got me.
You don't have to do that, Cesare.
No, I have to. I made you do it. It's only fair that I do it too.
I mean... you're not wrong.
Okay... how am I supposed to shop for you? Maybe I can still get that mask back? You clearly liked it.
I never want to see that thing again! It's brought me enough trouble from you!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
This is our last stop before we head out.
Do we really have to leave? I haven't managed to track down something for you yet.
With that situation resolved, we're not needed to patrol around here anymore. We've got to leave and get our next mission.
I know. That doesn't mean I have to be happy about it.

Fields.MenuText: I don't care if you're happy about it, as long as you do it.
Don't pout. You're the one that wanted to save the day.
I thought you said you could just remember your time here. Like with your art.

Fields.DialogueText: Ouch, that's harsh. You don't have to be so mean, Capitano.
I know. I just didn't think about it at the time. How was I supposed to know I'd want more time here?
But now I have to wait until we get back to Italy. I don't think I'm very patient.
Have you at least enjoyed your time here?
Of course. It was great. And I really should thank you for that. I never would've gotten to experience any of this if it wasn't for you.
Well, you earned it. And I wanted you to enjoy yourself a little.
Because we're friends, right?
Is that even a question you have to ask?
I ask every question. You know that.
Of course we're friends.
Then as friends, there's one last thing I'd like to do before we leave.
If we have time. Maybe.
That means yes, right? Usually maybe means yes.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So the last thing you wanted to see was Mount Fuji, huh?
Well, I'd prefer to see it from the top. I'm a ship, so this is the best I can get.
Well, it's certainly impressive.
Come on... Do it! Please... Please... Please...
What are you doing?
Hmmm? What do you mean?
You were just muttering something with your eyes closed. And you still have your fingers crossed.
Okay, I was... kind of hoping that it might erupt. Mount Fuji's active, right? I've always wanted to see an actual volcano erupt! Wouldn't that be awesome!?

Fields.MenuText: Not for the people running from the lava!
Actually, that would be pretty amazing.
Eh, once you've seen one volcano erupt, you've seen ‘em all.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I didn't even think of that. Would people die? Oh, I'm really torn now.
Right?! It would be a once in a lifetime sight. And we'd be watching it!
Wait, does that mean you've actually seen a volcano erupt? No way, I can't believe it!
You know, you can't make a volcano erupt just by wishing for it.
I know. I'm also hoping. And crossing my fingers.
It's not going to erupt, is it?
If it did, you'd basically be the luckiest Belle ever.
Does that mean we can wait a little while? See if I'm maybe really lucky? Maybe that's another talent that I have! What if it is?
Nope, we've got places to be. Come on, it's time to go.
But Capitano, what if it goes off while we're leaving? How foolish would you feel then?
Nothing is erupting today. Come on, it's time to go!
Aw... I was looking forward to bragging about this to Cavour. She would've been so jealous...
Looks like the Morganas wanted to see us off! Got any parting gifts for 'em, Cesare?
A gift? Was I supposed to get a gift? Do you think they'd want the mask? But then I probably shouldn't give it to them, right?
Just a figure of speech, Cesare.
@BATTLE
